subject: Payment Processing Module on Data Lake for submission of Bills and Processing of Payments related to Capturing of High-Resolution Imagery through Drones for NHAI Projects - reg.
text: #Ra <4 TTHRf qiferazrot (TTe3 9dev #r TTHPf #AT4, IRT TRR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Hqa ~ad vi-5 & 6, Ra7-10, E1VT, T8 facait 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka,; New Delhi-110075 T/Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI /Policy Guidelines /IT /2025 Policy Circular No. 6.40/2025 dated 01st April, 2025 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/IT /Drone/2020 (Comp. No. 8922)} Sub: Payment Processing Module on Data Lake for submission of Bills and Processing of Payments related to Capturing of High-Resolution Imagery through Drones for NHAI Projects reg: Ref.: i) Policy Circular No. 6.33/2022 dated 18.10.2022 ii) Policy Circular No. 18.98/2024 dated 01.10.2024 Vide Policy Circular No. 18.98/2024 dated 01.10.2024, the detailed process of System Generated Work Orders with Schedules, to empaneled Drone Service Providers (DSPs) , from Data Lake Portal to Capture High-Resolution Imagery through Drones on all eligible Projects is stipulated: The DSP Captures High-Resolution Imagery through Drone Survey as per the revised Standard Operating Procedure (SoP): The Drone Survey should be conducted and completed preferably in the last week every month such that its results can be used to prepare the MPR in the subsequent month: The captured data set is then uploaded on the cloud, where it shall have to pass through System Generated Quality Check (QC) to Verify/ Confirm that the output is in conformity to the revised SOP. The result of QC will be available on Data Lake for DSP reference. In case, the QC results indicate a "Failed" status, the corrected imagery needs to be re-loaded by the DSP. The Payment to the DSP for the Drone Survey shall be done by the concerned PIUs Subject to the data uploaded as well as compliance with the revised SOP . 2 To ensure transparency and facilitate speedy release of eligible Payments, of all routine Monthly Invoices/ Bills, to DSP a module is developed in Data Lake Portal. This module of online Submission and Processing of DSP Bills is in-line with processing of other Bills of claimants (Viz. Concessionaire/ Contractor/ Consultants, etc:) in Data Lake Portal to ensure Project-based accounting at AFMS. 3_ The entire workflow of Claim / Invoice submission and its Final approval to convert the Claim into accepted Claim by NHAI,   including any to-and-fro movement for   seeking clarifications etc. shall only be carried out in Data Lake Portal and not through e-Office or any other mode. After acceptance and approval of Claim with the Final Amount, it shall flow to AFMS automatically in respective module for preparation of Bill and Voucher and thereafter the Payment is paid to DSP through PFMS or CBS, as the case may be. 4 Following directions shall be Strictly followed by all concerned involved while processing the Payment of DSP: All Payments of High-Resolution Imagery Captured through Drones for NHAI Projects viz. Under-Construction (UC) and Operations and Maintenance (O&M) as per revised SoP W.e.f 01.10.2024 shall be applicable in this System: ji. The DSP shall   mandatorily submit online Invoice/ Bills with all   supporting Documents in Data Lake Portal using their Credentials_ The DSP shall raise online Bills, for such Projects, which Qualifies System Generated Quality Check (QC) Parameters.
